thread.title: Blunderbuss comes out and then the party’s over
thread.title_full: Blunderbuss comes out and then the party’s over

title: Blunderbuss comes out and then the party’s over
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Blunderbuss comes out and then the party’s over Dr Strangelove might have been more suitable than The Red Flag John Springer Collection/ Corbis Patrick Kidd Published 1 minute ago 
There was no chance of Jeremy Corbyn standing in silence for this song. The Labour conference drew to its close with The Red Flag , sung with a vigour that had not been seen since Peter Mandelson shaved his moustache. Given the nuclear war that had just been ignited in the parliamentary party, maybe We’ll Meet Again and a montage of mushroom clouds, echoing the ending of Dr Strangelove , would have been more suitable. 
In the hall, it seemed that all the leader’s pleas for a kinder approach to politics had fallen on deaf ears. First Andy Burnham repeated, for the Subscribe now
